isis.stitle: Recall 96502 - RA-42 (Code 14042) Rear Drive Axle Housing - S-Series and Cargostar Models

recall.subject: RA-42 (Code 14042) Rear Drive Axle Housing - S-Series and Cargostar Models

defect.para: This Recall applies to S-Series Bus Models 1723 and 1853; S-Series Truck Models 1724, 1754, 1824, 1854, and 1925; and Cargostar Models CO-1710 and CO-1850. These vehicles were built from 02/21/1982 through 04/07/1982.

Certain RA-42 (code 14042) rear drive axle housings may have been manufactured with smaller than intended friction weld curl radius on the inside diameter of the spindle during the friction-weld process. With a small curl radius, increased stress concentration occurs at this location. After numerous operational loads, cracks may initiate at this location, grow, and eventually result in separation of the spindle from the housing.
Because this type of crack initiates on the inside of the axle housing, the crack cannot be detected easily by inspecting the axle housing.

However, if a crack were to develop which extends through the housing, axle lubricant MAY seep through the crack. If this seepage occurs, it would appear as either a wet spot or a lubricant leak (drip) from the axle housing near the brake mounting flange. If this condition is observed, the vehicle should not be operated until the axle housing is replaced.

If a complete spindle weld separation were to occur, the disengaged wheel assembly could pose a hazard to other users of the roadway and adjacent property. This condition would also affect vehicle stability and control and could cause a vehicle crash without prior warning possibly resulting in property damage or personal injury or both.

The axle housing serial number and manufacturing code is provided on an identification tag affixed to the rear of the axle housing to the right of the differential carrier bowl (as viewed from the rear of the vehicle).
Serial Number - The 7 digit serial number appears in the last line of data which appears on the tag (Example: KN45770)

Axle Manufacturing Code - This code appears in Julian format (Day-Year) and is hand stamped on the right hand portion of the tag (Example: 058 H 82). This information will be needed to obtain a repair authorization.

Only RA-42 axle housings which are identified with a serial number listed below require replacement. Axle housings with other serial numbers do not require replacement.
Should difficulty be encountered reading the data on the identification tag, it might be helpful to scrape any paint or road grime from the plate and rub it with chalk to highlight the serial number and axle manufacturing code information.

note.para: Before replacing an axle housing, the servicing dealer MUST report the axle identification information to Tom Bowman at Rockwell on (248) 435-1725 to obtain authorization to replace the housing. The following information should be available at the time of the call:

item.para: Reference Rockwell Program CNAB or Navistar Recall 96502
Axle housing serial number (Sample: KN 1045770) - found on axle ID tag
Axle manufacturing code (Sample: 343 P 81) - found on axle ID tag

para.emph: Rockwell will issue a Repair Authorization Number when the axle housing serial number and manufacturing code fall within the suspect range. The Repair Authorization Number should be referenced on the warranty claim.

Should the serial number plate with the serial number and axle manufacturing code not be found on the axle housing, or if the serial number plate does not have a serial number as listed above, Tom Bowman at Rockwell will provide proper guidance to the dealer.

defect.para: Owners will be notified of this campaign on their vehicles by Navistar. A listing of owner names and addresses has been furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Refer to the following Service Manual Sections as applicable:

item.para: CTS-4086 Brakes, Hydraulic Split System - code 4055
CTS-4087 Brakes, Hydraulic Split System - code 4044, 4049
CTS-4336 Brakes, Hydraulic Split System, Cargostar - code 4083

note.para: Plug any unused holes in housing.
Order via "Quick Ship Program" from Rockwell International, Florence, Kentucky. Refer to PL-320KA.

entry.para: Remove and replace rear axle housing
Inspection only - axle housing replacement not required

para.emph: The removed axle housing should be held at the repair facility pending reimbursement of the warranty claim. The warranty claim may be denied if the repair facility is requested to provide the removed axle housing for inspection and is unable to do so. After the warranty claim is approved, the axle housing must be destroyed to prevent inadvertent re-use.

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward. The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair the vehicle as soon as possible.

claims.para: Refer to Dealer Warranty Manual for procedures to conduct Recall Campaigns.
In addition to normal warranty information furnished with the warranty claim, the following additional information is required:
Customer name and address, Removed axle housing serial number and build date, and Repair Authorization Number obtained from Rockwell.

It is important that the Recall Coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to Items 39 through 44:

responex.para: We ask for your full cooperation and follow-up to this important subject matter. If you have any questions or need further assistance, please contact the Regional Service Manager at your regional office.
